alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 3:36PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Essex, southwestern Lamoille, northwestern Orange, northwestern Addison, southern Chittenden and northwestern Washington Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 336 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Essex, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Vergennes, Montpelier, South Burlington, Essex, Westport, Monkton Ridge, Waterbury Village, Monkton, Monkton Boro, Williston, Middlesex, Hinesburg, St. George, Moretown, Starksboro, Shelburne, Ferrisburg, Charlotte, Waltham and Stowe. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 46 and 48, and between mile markers 50 and 82. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northern New York...and central and northwestern Vermont.
